intro: Gastonia eupteronoides, commonly known as the Brazilian flame tree, is a tropical plant native to South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, red-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has palmately lobed leaves and produces woody capsules as fruit. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes in tropical and subtropical regions.
